snippet: The former chief of security for the Upper Big Branch mine, where 29 miners died in an explosion in 2010, was sentenced Wednesday to three years in prison.
abstract: Hughie Elbert Stover, the former chief for the Upper Big Branch mine, is sentenced to three years in prison for lying to federal officials and obstructing the investigation into the explosion that led to the deaths of 29 miners.
lead_paragraph: The former chief of security for the Upper Big Branch mine, where 29 miners died in an explosion in 2010, was sentenced Wednesday to three years in prison.

headline.main: West Virginia: Mine Security Chief Gets 3-Year Prison Term
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: Mine Security Chief Gets 3-Year Prison Term
